Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Identified all activities mentioned by the interviewees: receiving the invoice, checking for a PO, logging it into the system, forwarding to the purchasing department, matching the invoice with the PO, sending it to the manager for approval, handling discrepancies, escalating issues, and scheduling payment.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Inferred the sequence flow: starting with receiving the invoice, then checking for a PO, logging it, forwarding to purchasing, confirming receipt, matching invoice, sending to the manager, approving, and scheduling payment.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Identified decision points: First, checking if the invoice has a valid PO. If not, it is sent back to the supplier. Then, checking if the invoice details match the PO; if not, discrepancies are clarified. The manager then decides to approve or reject.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Recognized roles involved: Accounts Payable Clerk, Purchasing Officer, Department Manager, Accounts Payable Supervisor, and Supplier Relationship Manager.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Generalized from the interviews to identify artifacts: invoices, POs, emails, and notifications. Inputs are the received invoice, and outputs include confirmed payments and payment schedules.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Cross-checked the process flow and roles with the interview data to ensure consistency and logical coherence in the model.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Proposed potential exceptions and variations based on the interview data: missing POs, discrepancies in invoices, manager rejections, and handling of informal contracts.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Assumed that exceptions like missing POs or discrepancies are resolved before moving forward in the process flow, as no explicit resolution timeframes were provided.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Revisited the decision points to ensure all possible variations (e.g., rejection by manager, escalation to supervisor) were accounted for.
